alert.note: Alert for Bath; Fleming; Montgomery; Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 6:06PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Montgomery, Bath, Fleming and northwestern Rowan Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 605 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Carlisle to near Sideview to Winchester. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Sideview around 610 PM EDT. Judy around 615 PM EDT. Sharpsburg, Wades Mill, Prewitt, Klondike, Cowan and Grassy Lick around 620 PM EDT. Mount Sterling, Camargo, Elizaville, Nepton, Reynoldsville, Ewington, Gatewoods Station, Craintown, Bethel and Pecks Ridge around 625 PM EDT. Flemingsburg, Howards Mill, Oakley, Odessa, Stepstone, Pebble, Coons Station, Upper Spencer, Lower Spencer and Flat Creek around 630 PM EDT. Owingsville, Kendall Springs, Grange City, Preston, Crooks, Hillsboro, Peeled Oak, Wyoming, Hope and Poplar Plains around 635 PM EDT. Ringos Mills, Foxport, Bourbon Furnace, Olympia, Mount Carmel, Peasticks, Craigs, Slate Valley, Sharkey and Wallingford around 640 PM EDT. Marshall, Salt Lick, Polksville, Plummers Landing, Moore`s Ferry, Muses Mills, Midland, Hilda, Ramey and Farmers around 645 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Ewing, Flemingsburg Junction and Mount Gilead. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
